intro: Oxydectes vaccinioides, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features woolly, lobed leaves and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its ornamental value and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping in desert landscapes.
